intro: Dodonaea eriocarpa f. obtusior, commonly known as the smoothleaf velvetleaf, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its finely hairy leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The leaves are elliptical and have a smooth, rounded appearance, distinguishing it from other varieties of Dodonaea. It produces small, round, woody fruits that contain seeds. This plant is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought conditions.
